10144 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype_, xpath_ast_node* left = 0, xpath_ast_node* right = 0):
10145 _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(static_cast<char>(rettype_)), _axis(0), _test(0), _left(left), _right(right), _next(0)
10146 {
10147 }
10148
10149 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_ast_node* left, axis_t axis, nodetest_t test, const char_t* contents):
10150 _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(xpath_type_node_set), _axis(static_cast<char>(axis)), _test(static_cast<char>(test)), _left(left), _right(0), _next(0)
10151 {
10152 assert(type == ast_step)(static_cast <bool> (type == ast_step) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("type == ast_step", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10152, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10153 _data.nodetest = contents;
10154 }
10155
10156 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_ast_node* left, xpath_ast_node* right, predicate_t test):
10157 _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(xpath_type_node_set), _axis(0), _test(static_cast<char>(test)), _left(left), _right(right), _next(0)
10158 {
10159 assert(type == ast_filter || type == ast_predicate)(static_cast <bool> (type == ast_filter || type == ast_predicate
) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("type == ast_filter || type == ast_predicate"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10159, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10160 }
10161
10162 void set_next(xpath_ast_node* value)
10163 {
10164 _next = value;
10165 }
10166
10167 void set_right(xpath_ast_node* value)
10168 {
10169 _right = value;
10170 }
10171
10172 bool eval_boolean(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
10173 {
10174 switch (_type)
10175 {
10176 case ast_op_or:
10177 return _left->eval_boolean(c, stack) || _right->eval_boolean(c, stack);
10178
10179 case ast_op_and:
10180 return _left->eval_boolean(c, stack) && _right->eval_boolean(c, stack);
10181
10182 case ast_op_equal:
10183 return compare_eq(_left, _right, c, stack, equal_to());
10184
10185 case ast_op_not_equal:
10186 return compare_eq(_left, _right, c, stack, not_equal_to());
10187
10188 case ast_op_less:
10189 return compare_rel(_left, _right, c, stack, less());
10190
10191 case ast_op_greater:
10192 return compare_rel(_right, _left, c, stack, less());
10193
10194 case ast_op_less_or_equal:
10195 return compare_rel(_left, _right, c, stack, less_equal());
10196
10197 case ast_op_greater_or_equal:
10198 return compare_rel(_right, _left, c, stack, less_equal());
10199
10200 case ast_func_starts_with:
10201 {
10202 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10203
10204 xpath_string lr = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10205 xpath_string rr = _right->eval_string(c, stack);
10206
10207 return starts_with(lr.c_str(), rr.c_str());
10208 }
10209
10210 case ast_func_contains:
10211 {
10212 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10213
10214 xpath_string lr = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10215 xpath_string rr = _right->eval_string(c, stack);
10216
10217 return find_substring(lr.c_str(), rr.c_str()) != 0;
10218 }
10219
10220 case ast_func_boolean:
10221 return _left->eval_boolean(c, stack);
10222
10223 case ast_func_not:
10224 return !_left->eval_boolean(c, stack);
10225
10226 case ast_func_true:
10227 return true;
10228
10229 case ast_func_false:
10230 return false;
10231
10232 case ast_func_lang:
10233 {
10234 if (c.n.attribute()) return false;
10235
10236 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10237
10238 xpath_string lang = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10239
10240 for (xml_node n = c.n.node(); n; n = n.parent())
10241 {
10242 xml_attribute a = n.attribute(PUGIXML_TEXT("xml:lang")"xml:lang");
10243
10244 if (a)
10245 {
10246 const char_t* value = a.value();
10247
10248 // strnicmp / strncasecmp is not portable
10249 for (const char_t* lit = lang.c_str(); *lit; ++lit)
10250 {
10251 if (tolower_ascii(*lit) != tolower_ascii(*value)) return false;
10252 ++value;
10253 }
10254
10255 return *value == 0 || *value == '-';
10256 }
10257 }
10258
10259 return false;
10260 }
10261
10262 case ast_opt_compare_attribute:
10263 {
10264 const char_t* value = (_right->_type == ast_string_constant) ? _right->_data.string : _right->_data.variable->get_string();
10265
10266 xml_attribute attr = c.n.node().attribute(_left->_data.nodetest);
10267
10268 return attr && strequal(attr.value(), value) && is_xpath_attribute(attr.name());
10269 }
10270
10271 case ast_variable:
10272 {
10273 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type())(static_cast <bool> (_rettype == _data.variable->type
()) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("_rettype == _data.variable->type()"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10273, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10274
10275 if (_rettype == xpath_type_boolean)
10276 return _data.variable->get_boolean();
10277 }
10278
10279 // fallthrough
10280 default:
10281 {
10282 switch (_rettype)
10283 {
10284 case xpath_type_number:
10285 return convert_number_to_boolean(eval_number(c, stack));
10286
10287 case xpath_type_string:
10288 {
10289 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10290
10291 return !eval_string(c, stack).empty();
10292 }
10293
10294 case xpath_type_node_set:
10295 {
10296 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10297
10298 return !eval_node_set(c, stack, nodeset_eval_any).empty();
10299 }
10300
10301 default:
10302 assert(false && "Wrong expression for return type boolean")(static_cast <bool> (false && "Wrong expression for return type boolean"
) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("false && \"Wrong expression for return type boolean\""
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10302, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // unreachable
10303 return false;
10304 }
10305 }
10306 }
10307 }
10308
10309 double eval_number(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
10310 {
10311 switch (_type)
10312 {
10313 case ast_op_add:
10314 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) + _right->eval_number(c, stack);
10315
10316 case ast_op_subtract:
10317 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) - _right->eval_number(c, stack);
10318
10319 case ast_op_multiply:
10320 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) * _right->eval_number(c, stack);
10321
10322 case ast_op_divide:
10323 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) / _right->eval_number(c, stack);
10324
10325 case ast_op_mod:
10326 return fmod(_left->eval_number(c, stack), _right->eval_number(c, stack));
10327
10328 case ast_op_negate:
10329 return -_left->eval_number(c, stack);
10330
10331 case ast_number_constant:
10332 return _data.number;
10333
10334 case ast_func_last:
10335 return static_cast<double>(c.size);
10336
10337 case ast_func_position:
10338 return static_cast<double>(c.position);
10339
10340 case ast_func_count:
10341 {
10342 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10343
10344 return static_cast<double>(_left->eval_node_set(c, stack, nodeset_eval_all).size());
10345 }
10346
10347 case ast_func_string_length_0:
10348 {
10349 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10350
10351 return static_cast<double>(string_value(c.n, stack.result).length());
10352 }
10353
10354 case ast_func_string_length_1:
10355 {
10356 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10357
10358 return static_cast<double>(_left->eval_string(c, stack).length());
10359 }
10360
10361 case ast_func_number_0:
10362 {
10363 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10364
10365 return convert_string_to_number(string_value(c.n, stack.result).c_str());
10366 }
10367
10368 case ast_func_number_1:
10369 return _left->eval_number(c, stack);
10370
10371 case ast_func_sum:
10372 {
10373 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10374
10375 double r = 0;
10376
10377 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack, nodeset_eval_all);
10378
10379 for (const xpath_node* it = ns.begin(); it != ns.end(); ++it)
10380 {
10381 xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
10382
10383 r += convert_string_to_number(string_value(*it, stack.result).c_str());
10384 }
10385
10386 return r;
10387 }
10388
10389 case ast_func_floor:
10390 {
10391 double r = _left->eval_number(c, stack);
10392
10393 return r == r ? floor(r) : r;
10394 }
10395
10396 case ast_func_ceiling:
10397 {
10398 double r = _left->eval_number(c, stack);
10399
10400 return r == r ? ceil(r) : r;
10401 }
10402
10403 case ast_func_round:
10404 return round_nearest_nzero(_left->eval_number(c, stack));
10405
10406 case ast_variable:
10407 {
10408 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type())(static_cast <bool> (_rettype == _data.variable->type
()) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("_rettype == _data.variable->type()"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10408, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10409
10410 if (_rettype == xpath_type_number)
10411 return _data.variable->get_number();
10412 }
10413
10414 // fallthrough
10415 default:
10416 {
10417 switch (_rettype)
10418 {
10419 case xpath_type_boolean:
10420 return eval_boolean(c, stack) ? 1 : 0;
10421
10422 case xpath_type_string:
10423 {
10424 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10425
10426 return convert_string_to_number(eval_string(c, stack).c_str());
10427 }
10428
10429 case xpath_type_node_set:
10430 {
10431 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10432
10433 return convert_string_to_number(eval_string(c, stack).c_str());
10434 }
10435
10436 default:
10437 assert(false && "Wrong expression for return type number")(static_cast <bool> (false && "Wrong expression for return type number"
) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("false && \"Wrong expression for return type number\""
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10437, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // unreachable
10438 return 0;
10439 }
10440
10441 }
10442 }
10443 }
10444
10445 xpath_string eval_string_concat(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
10446 {
10447 assert(_type == ast_func_concat)(static_cast <bool> (_type == ast_func_concat) ? void (
0) : __assert_fail ("_type == ast_func_concat", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10447, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10448
10449 xpath_allocator_capture ct(stack.temp);
10450
10451 // count the string number
10452 size_t count = 1;
10453 for (xpath_ast_node* nc = _right; nc; nc = nc->_next) count++;
10454
10455 // allocate a buffer for temporary string objects
10456 xpath_string* buffer = static_cast<xpath_string*>(stack.temp->allocate(count * sizeof(xpath_string)));
10457 if (!buffer) return xpath_string();
10458
10459 // evaluate all strings to temporary stack
10460 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10461
10462 buffer[0] = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10463
10464 size_t pos = 1;
10465 for (xpath_ast_node* n = _right; n; n = n->_next, ++pos) buffer[pos] = n->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10466 assert(pos == count)(static_cast <bool> (pos == count) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("pos == count", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10466, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10467
10468 // get total length
10469 size_t length = 0;
10470 for (size_t i = 0; i < count; ++i) length += buffer[i].length();
10471
10472 // create final string
10473 char_t* result = static_cast<char_t*>(stack.result->allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
10474 if (!result) return xpath_string();
10475
10476 char_t* ri = result;
10477
10478 for (size_t j = 0; j < count; ++j)
10479 for (const char_t* bi = buffer[j].c_str(); *bi; ++bi)
10480 *ri++ = *bi;
10481
10482 *ri = 0;
10483
10484 return xpath_string::from_heap_preallocated(result, ri);
10485 }
10486
10487 xpath_string eval_string(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
10488 {
10489 switch (_type)
10490 {
10491 case ast_string_constant:
10492 return xpath_string::from_const(_data.string);
10493
10494 case ast_func_local_name_0:
10495 {
10496 xpath_node na = c.n;
10497
10498 return xpath_string::from_const(local_name(na));
10499 }
10500
10501 case ast_func_local_name_1:
10502 {
10503 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10504
10505 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack, nodeset_eval_first);
10506 xpath_node na = ns.first();
10507
10508 return xpath_string::from_const(local_name(na));
10509 }
10510
10511 case ast_func_name_0:
10512 {
10513 xpath_node na = c.n;
10514
10515 return xpath_string::from_const(qualified_name(na));
10516 }
10517
10518 case ast_func_name_1:
10519 {
10520 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10521
10522 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack, nodeset_eval_first);
10523 xpath_node na = ns.first();
10524
10525 return xpath_string::from_const(qualified_name(na));
10526 }
10527
10528 case ast_func_namespace_uri_0:
10529 {
10530 xpath_node na = c.n;
10531
10532 return xpath_string::from_const(namespace_uri(na));
10533 }
10534
10535 case ast_func_namespace_uri_1:
10536 {
10537 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
10538
10539 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack, nodeset_eval_first);
10540 xpath_node na = ns.first();
10541
10542 return xpath_string::from_const(namespace_uri(na));
10543 }
10544
10545 case ast_func_string_0:
10546 return string_value(c.n, stack.result);
10547
10548 case ast_func_string_1:
10549 return _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10550
10551 case ast_func_concat:
10552 return eval_string_concat(c, stack);
10553
10554 case ast_func_substring_before:
10555 {
10556 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10557
10558 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10559
10560 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10561 xpath_string p = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10562
10563 const char_t* pos = find_substring(s.c_str(), p.c_str());
10564
10565 return pos ? xpath_string::from_heap(s.c_str(), pos, stack.result) : xpath_string();
10566 }
10567
10568 case ast_func_substring_after:
10569 {
10570 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10571
10572 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10573
10574 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10575 xpath_string p = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10576
10577 const char_t* pos = find_substring(s.c_str(), p.c_str());
10578 if (!pos) return xpath_string();
10579
10580 const char_t* rbegin = pos + p.length();
10581 const char_t* rend = s.c_str() + s.length();
10582
10583 return s.uses_heap() ? xpath_string::from_heap(rbegin, rend, stack.result) : xpath_string::from_const(rbegin);
10584 }
10585
10586 case ast_func_substring_2:
10587 {
10588 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10589
10590 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10591
10592 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10593 size_t s_length = s.length();
10594
10595 double first = round_nearest(_right->eval_number(c, stack));
10596
10597 if (is_nan(first)) return xpath_string(); // NaN
10598 else if (first >= s_length + 1) return xpath_string();
10599
10600 size_t pos = first < 1 ? 1 : static_cast<size_t>(first);
10601 assert(1 <= pos && pos <= s_length + 1)(static_cast <bool> (1 <= pos && pos <= s_length
+ 1) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("1 <= pos && pos <= s_length + 1"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10601, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10602
10603 const char_t* rbegin = s.c_str() + (pos - 1);
10604 const char_t* rend = s.c_str() + s.length();
10605
10606 return s.uses_heap() ? xpath_string::from_heap(rbegin, rend, stack.result) : xpath_string::from_const(rbegin);
10607 }
10608
10609 case ast_func_substring_3:
10610 {
10611 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10612
10613 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10614
10615 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10616 size_t s_length = s.length();
10617
10618 double first = round_nearest(_right->eval_number(c, stack));
10619 double last = first + round_nearest(_right->_next->eval_number(c, stack));
10620
10621 if (is_nan(first) || is_nan(last)) return xpath_string();
10622 else if (first >= s_length + 1) return xpath_string();
10623 else if (first >= last) return xpath_string();
10624 else if (last < 1) return xpath_string();
10625
10626 size_t pos = first < 1 ? 1 : static_cast<size_t>(first);
10627 size_t end = last >= s_length + 1 ? s_length + 1 : static_cast<size_t>(last);
10628
10629 assert(1 <= pos && pos <= end && end <= s_length + 1)(static_cast <bool> (1 <= pos && pos <= end
&& end <= s_length + 1) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("1 <= pos && pos <= end && end <= s_length + 1"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10629, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10630 const char_t* rbegin = s.c_str() + (pos - 1);
10631 const char_t* rend = s.c_str() + (end - 1);
10632
10633 return (end == s_length + 1 && !s.uses_heap()) ? xpath_string::from_const(rbegin) : xpath_string::from_heap(rbegin, rend, stack.result);
10634 }
10635
10636 case ast_func_normalize_space_0:
10637 {
10638 xpath_string s = string_value(c.n, stack.result);
10639
10640 char_t* begin = s.data(stack.result);
10641 if (!begin) return xpath_string();
10642
10643 char_t* end = normalize_space(begin);
10644
10645 return xpath_string::from_heap_preallocated(begin, end);
10646 }
10647
10648 case ast_func_normalize_space_1:
10649 {
10650 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10651
10652 char_t* begin = s.data(stack.result);
10653 if (!begin) return xpath_string();
10654
10655 char_t* end = normalize_space(begin);
10656
10657 return xpath_string::from_heap_preallocated(begin, end);
10658 }
10659
10660 case ast_func_translate:
10661 {
10662 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10663
10664 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10665
10666 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10667 xpath_string from = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10668 xpath_string to = _right->_next->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
10669
10670 char_t* begin = s.data(stack.result);
10671 if (!begin) return xpath_string();
10672
10673 char_t* end = translate(begin, from.c_str(), to.c_str(), to.length());
10674
10675 return xpath_string::from_heap_preallocated(begin, end);
10676 }
10677
10678 case ast_opt_translate_table:
10679 {
10680 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
10681
10682 char_t* begin = s.data(stack.result);
10683 if (!begin) return xpath_string();
10684
10685 char_t* end = translate_table(begin, _data.table);
10686
10687 return xpath_string::from_heap_preallocated(begin, end);
10688 }
10689
10690 case ast_variable:
10691 {
10692 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type())(static_cast <bool> (_rettype == _data.variable->type
()) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("_rettype == _data.variable->type()"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10692, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10693
10694 if (_rettype == xpath_type_string)
10695 return xpath_string::from_const(_data.variable->get_string());
10696 }
10697
10698 // fallthrough
10699 default:
10700 {
10701 switch (_rettype)
10702 {
10703 case xpath_type_boolean:
10704 return xpath_string::from_const(eval_boolean(c, stack) ? PUGIXML_TEXT("true")"true" : PUGIXML_TEXT("false")"false");
10705
10706 case xpath_type_number:
10707 return convert_number_to_string(eval_number(c, stack), stack.result);
10708
10709 case xpath_type_node_set:
10710 {
10711 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10712
10713 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10714
10715 xpath_node_set_raw ns = eval_node_set(c, swapped_stack, nodeset_eval_first);
10716 return ns.empty() ? xpath_string() : string_value(ns.first(), stack.result);
10717 }
10718
10719 default:
10720 assert(false && "Wrong expression for return type string")(static_cast <bool> (false && "Wrong expression for return type string"
) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("false && \"Wrong expression for return type string\""
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10720, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // unreachable
10721 return xpath_string();
10722 }
10723 }
10724 }
10725 }
10726
10727 xpath_node_set_raw eval_node_set(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack, nodeset_eval_t eval)
10728 {
10729 switch (_type)
10730 {
10731 case ast_op_union:
10732 {
10733 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
10734
10735 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
10736
10737 xpath_node_set_raw ls = _left->eval_node_set(c, swapped_stack, eval);
10738 xpath_node_set_raw rs = _right->eval_node_set(c, stack, eval);
10739
10740 // we can optimize merging two sorted sets, but this is a very rare operation, so don't bother
10741 rs.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_unsorted);
10742
10743 rs.append(ls.begin(), ls.end(), stack.result);
10744 rs.remove_duplicates();
10745
10746 return rs;
10747 }
10748
10749 case ast_filter:
10750 {
10751 xpath_node_set_raw set = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack, _test == predicate_constant_one ? nodeset_eval_first : nodeset_eval_all);
10752
10753 // either expression is a number or it contains position() call; sort by document order
10754 if (_test != predicate_posinv) set.sort_do();
10755
10756 bool once = eval_once(set.type(), eval);
10757
10758 apply_predicate(set, 0, stack, once);
10759
10760 return set;
10761 }
10762
10763 case ast_func_id:
10764 return xpath_node_set_raw();
10765
10766 case ast_step:
10767 {
10768 switch (_axis)
10769 {
10770 case axis_ancestor:
10771 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_ancestor>());
10772
10773 case axis_ancestor_or_self:
10774 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_ancestor_or_self>());
10775
10776 case axis_attribute:
10777 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_attribute>());
10778
10779 case axis_child:
10780 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_child>());
10781
10782 case axis_descendant:
10783 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_descendant>());
10784
10785 case axis_descendant_or_self:
10786 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_descendant_or_self>());
10787
10788 case axis_following:
10789 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_following>());
10790
10791 case axis_following_sibling:
10792 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_following_sibling>());
10793
10794 case axis_namespace:
10795 // namespaced axis is not supported
10796 return xpath_node_set_raw();
10797
10798 case axis_parent:
10799 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_parent>());
10800
10801 case axis_preceding:
10802 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_preceding>());
10803
10804 case axis_preceding_sibling:
10805 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_preceding_sibling>());
10806
10807 case axis_self:
10808 return step_do(c, stack, eval, axis_to_type<axis_self>());
10809
10810 default:
10811 assert(false && "Unknown axis")(static_cast <bool> (false && "Unknown axis") ?
void (0) : __assert_fail ("false && \"Unknown axis\""
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10811, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // unreachable
10812 return xpath_node_set_raw();
10813 }
10814 }
10815
10816 case ast_step_root:
10817 {
10818 assert(!_right)(static_cast <bool> (!_right) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("!_right", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10818, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // root step can't have any predicates
10819
10820 xpath_node_set_raw ns;
10821
10822 ns.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_sorted);
10823
10824 if (c.n.node()) ns.push_back(c.n.node().root(), stack.result);
10825 else if (c.n.attribute()) ns.push_back(c.n.parent().root(), stack.result);
10826
10827 return ns;
10828 }
10829
10830 case ast_variable:
10831 {
10832 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type())(static_cast <bool> (_rettype == _data.variable->type
()) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("_rettype == _data.variable->type()"
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10832, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10833
10834 if (_rettype == xpath_type_node_set)
10835 {
10836 const xpath_node_set& s = _data.variable->get_node_set();
10837
10838 xpath_node_set_raw ns;
10839
10840 ns.set_type(s.type());
10841 ns.append(s.begin(), s.end(), stack.result);
10842
10843 return ns;
10844 }
10845 }
10846
10847 // fallthrough
10848 default:
10849 assert(false && "Wrong expression for return type node set")(static_cast <bool> (false && "Wrong expression for return type node set"
) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("false && \"Wrong expression for return type node set\""
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10849, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // unreachable
10850 return xpath_node_set_raw();
10851 }
10852 }
10853
10854 void optimize(xpath_allocator* alloc)
10855 {
10856 if (_left)
16
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
17
←
Assuming pointer value is null
→
18
←
Taking false branch
→
10857 _left->optimize(alloc);
10858
10859 if (_right)
19
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
20
←
Taking false branch
→
10860 _right->optimize(alloc);
10861
10862 if (_next)
21
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
22
←
Taking false branch
→
10863 _next->optimize(alloc);
10864
10865 optimize_self(alloc);
23
←
Calling 'xpath_ast_node::optimize_self'
→
10866 }
10867
10868 void optimize_self(xpath_allocator* alloc)
10869 {
10870 // Rewrite [position()=expr] with [expr]
10871 // Note that this step has to go before classification to recognize [position()=1]
10872 if ((_type == ast_filter || _type == ast_predicate) &&
24
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
25
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
10873 _right->_type == ast_op_equal && _right->_left->_type == ast_func_position && _right->_right->_rettype == xpath_type_number)
10874 {
10875 _right = _right->_right;
10876 }
10877
10878 // Classify filter/predicate ops to perform various optimizations during evaluation
10879 if (_type == ast_filter || _type == ast_predicate)
26
←
Taking false branch
→
10880 {
10881 assert(_test == predicate_default)(static_cast <bool> (_test == predicate_default) ? void
(0) : __assert_fail ("_test == predicate_default", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10881, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10882
10883 if (_right->_type == ast_number_constant && _right->_data.number == 1.0)
10884 _test = predicate_constant_one;
10885 else if (_right->_rettype == xpath_type_number && (_right->_type == ast_number_constant || _right->_type == ast_variable || _right->_type == ast_func_last))
10886 _test = predicate_constant;
10887 else if (_right->_rettype != xpath_type_number && _right->is_posinv_expr())
10888 _test = predicate_posinv;
10889 }
10890
10891 // Rewrite descendant-or-self::node()/child::foo with descendant::foo
10892 // The former is a full form of //foo, the latter is much faster since it executes the node test immediately
10893 // Do a similar kind of rewrite for self/descendant/descendant-or-self axes
10894 // Note that we only rewrite positionally invariant steps (//foo[1] != /descendant::foo[1])
10895 if (_type == ast_step && (_axis == axis_child || _axis == axis_self || _axis == axis_descendant || _axis == axis_descendant_or_self) && _left &&
27
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
10896 _left->_type == ast_step && _left->_axis == axis_descendant_or_self && _left->_test == nodetest_type_node && !_left->_right &&
10897 is_posinv_step())
10898 {
10899 if (_axis == axis_child || _axis == axis_descendant)
10900 _axis = axis_descendant;
10901 else
10902 _axis = axis_descendant_or_self;
10903
10904 _left = _left->_left;
10905 }
10906
10907 // Use optimized lookup table implementation for translate() with constant arguments
10908 if (_type == ast_func_translate && _right->_type == ast_string_constant && _right->_next->_type == ast_string_constant)
28
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
10909 {
10910 unsigned char* table = translate_table_generate(alloc, _right->_data.string, _right->_next->_data.string);
10911
10912 if (table)
10913 {
10914 _type = ast_opt_translate_table;
10915 _data.table = table;
10916 }
10917 }
10918
10919 // Use optimized path for @attr = 'value' or @attr = $value
10920 if (_type == ast_op_equal &&
29
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
10921 _left->_type == ast_step && _left->_axis == axis_attribute && _left->_test == nodetest_name && !_left->_left && !_left->_right &&
30
←
Access to field '_type' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from field '_left')
10922 (_right->_type == ast_string_constant || (_right->_type == ast_variable && _right->_rettype == xpath_type_string)))
10923 {
10924 _type = ast_opt_compare_attribute;
10925 }
10926 }
10927
10928 bool is_posinv_expr() const
10929 {
10930 switch (_type)
10931 {
10932 case ast_func_position:
10933 case ast_func_last:
10934 return false;
10935
10936 case ast_string_constant:
10937 case ast_number_constant:
10938 case ast_variable:
10939 return true;
10940
10941 case ast_step:
10942 case ast_step_root:
10943 return true;
10944
10945 case ast_predicate:
10946 case ast_filter:
10947 return true;
10948
10949 default:
10950 if (_left && !_left->is_posinv_expr()) return false;
10951
10952 for (xpath_ast_node* n = _right; n; n = n->_next)
10953 if (!n->is_posinv_expr()) return false;
10954
10955 return true;
10956 }
10957 }
10958
10959 bool is_posinv_step() const
10960 {
10961 assert(_type == ast_step)(static_cast <bool> (_type == ast_step) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("_type == ast_step", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10961, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10962
10963 for (xpath_ast_node* n = _right; n; n = n->_next)
10964 {
10965 assert(n->_type == ast_predicate)(static_cast <bool> (n->_type == ast_predicate) ? void
(0) : __assert_fail ("n->_type == ast_predicate", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 10965, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
10966
10967 if (n->_test != predicate_posinv)
10968 return false;
10969 }
10970
10971 return true;
10972 }
10973
10974 xpath_value_type rettype() const
10975 {
10976 return static_cast<xpath_value_type>(_rettype);
10977 }
10978 };
10979
10980 struct xpath_parser
10981 {
10982 xpath_allocator* _alloc;
10983 xpath_lexer _lexer;
10984
10985 const char_t* _query;
10986 xpath_variable_set* _variables;
10987
10988 xpath_parse_result* _result;
10989
10990 char_t _scratch[32];
10991
10992 xpath_ast_node* error(const char* message)
10993 {
10994 _result->error = message;
10995 _result->offset = _lexer.current_pos() - _query;
10996
10997 return 0;
10998 }
10999
11000 xpath_ast_node* error_oom()
11001 {
11002 assert(_alloc->_error)(static_cast <bool> (_alloc->_error) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("_alloc->_error", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 11002, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
11003 *_alloc->_error = true;
11004
11005 return 0;
11006 }
11007
11008 void* alloc_node()
11009 {
11010 return _alloc->allocate(sizeof(xpath_ast_node));
11011 }
11012
11013 xpath_ast_node* alloc_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype, const char_t* value)
11014 {
11015 void* memory = alloc_node();
11016 return memory ? new (memory) xpath_ast_node(type, rettype, value) : 0;
11017 }
11018
11019 xpath_ast_node* alloc_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype, double value)
11020 {
11021 void* memory = alloc_node();
11022 return memory ? new (memory) xpath_ast_node(type, rettype, value) : 0;
11023 }
11024
11025 xpath_ast_node* alloc_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype, xpath_variable* value)
11026 {
11027 void* memory = alloc_node();
11028 return memory ? new (memory) xpath_ast_node(type, rettype, value) : 0;
11029 }
11030
11031 xpath_ast_node* alloc_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype, xpath_ast_node* left = 0, xpath_ast_node* right = 0)
11032 {
11033 void* memory = alloc_node();
11034 return memory ? new (memory) xpath_ast_node(type, rettype, left, right) : 0;
11035 }
11036
11037 xpath_ast_node* alloc_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_ast_node* left, axis_t axis, nodetest_t test, const char_t* contents)
11038 {
11039 void* memory = alloc_node();
11040 return memory ? new (memory) xpath_ast_node(type, left, axis, test, contents) : 0;
11041 }
11042
11043 xpath_ast_node* alloc_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_ast_node* left, xpath_ast_node* right, predicate_t test)
11044 {
11045 void* memory = alloc_node();
11046 return memory ? new (memory) xpath_ast_node(type, left, right, test) : 0;
11047 }
11048
11049 const char_t* alloc_string(const xpath_lexer_string& value)
11050 {
11051 if (!value.begin)
11052 return PUGIXML_TEXT("")"";
11053
11054 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(value.end - value.begin);
11055
11056 char_t* c = static_cast<char_t*>(_alloc->allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
11057 if (!c) return 0;
11058
11059 memcpy(c, value.begin, length * sizeof(char_t));
11060 c[length] = 0;
11061
11062 return c;
11063 }
11064
11065 xpath_ast_node* parse_function(const xpath_lexer_string& name, size_t argc, xpath_ast_node* args[2])
11066 {
11067 switch (name.begin[0])
11068 {
11069 case 'b':
11070 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("boolean")"boolean" && argc == 1)
11071 return alloc_node(ast_func_boolean, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]);
11072
11073 break;
11074
11075 case 'c':
11076 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("count")"count" && argc == 1)
11077 {
11078 if (args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) return error("Function has to be applied to node set");
11079 return alloc_node(ast_func_count, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11080 }
11081 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("contains")"contains" && argc == 2)
11082 return alloc_node(ast_func_contains, xpath_type_boolean, args[0], args[1]);
11083 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("concat")"concat" && argc >= 2)
11084 return alloc_node(ast_func_concat, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
11085 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("ceiling")"ceiling" && argc == 1)
11086 return alloc_node(ast_func_ceiling, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11087
11088 break;
11089
11090 case 'f':
11091 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("false")"false" && argc == 0)
11092 return alloc_node(ast_func_false, xpath_type_boolean);
11093 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("floor")"floor" && argc == 1)
11094 return alloc_node(ast_func_floor, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11095
11096 break;
11097
11098 case 'i':
11099 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("id")"id" && argc == 1)
11100 return alloc_node(ast_func_id, xpath_type_node_set, args[0]);
11101
11102 break;
11103
11104 case 'l':
11105 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("last")"last" && argc == 0)
11106 return alloc_node(ast_func_last, xpath_type_number);
11107 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("lang")"lang" && argc == 1)
11108 return alloc_node(ast_func_lang, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]);
11109 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("local-name")"local-name" && argc <= 1)
11110 {
11111 if (argc == 1 && args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) return error("Function has to be applied to node set");
11112 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_local_name_0 : ast_func_local_name_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
11113 }
11114
11115 break;
11116
11117 case 'n':
11118 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("name")"name" && argc <= 1)
11119 {
11120 if (argc == 1 && args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) return error("Function has to be applied to node set");
11121 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_name_0 : ast_func_name_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
11122 }
11123 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("namespace-uri")"namespace-uri" && argc <= 1)
11124 {
11125 if (argc == 1 && args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) return error("Function has to be applied to node set");
11126 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_namespace_uri_0 : ast_func_namespace_uri_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
11127 }
11128 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("normalize-space")"normalize-space" && argc <= 1)
11129 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_normalize_space_0 : ast_func_normalize_space_1, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
11130 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("not")"not" && argc == 1)
11131 return alloc_node(ast_func_not, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]);
11132 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("number")"number" && argc <= 1)
11133 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_number_0 : ast_func_number_1, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11134
11135 break;
11136
11137 case 'p':
11138 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("position")"position" && argc == 0)
11139 return alloc_node(ast_func_position, xpath_type_number);
11140
11141 break;
11142
11143 case 'r':
11144 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("round")"round" && argc == 1)
11145 return alloc_node(ast_func_round, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11146
11147 break;
11148
11149 case 's':
11150 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("string")"string" && argc <= 1)
11151 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_string_0 : ast_func_string_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
11152 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("string-length")"string-length" && argc <= 1)
11153 return alloc_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_string_length_0 : ast_func_string_length_1, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11154 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("starts-with")"starts-with" && argc == 2)
11155 return alloc_node(ast_func_starts_with, xpath_type_boolean, args[0], args[1]);
11156 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("substring-before")"substring-before" && argc == 2)
11157 return alloc_node(ast_func_substring_before, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
11158 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("substring-after")"substring-after" && argc == 2)
11159 return alloc_node(ast_func_substring_after, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
11160 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("substring")"substring" && (argc == 2 || argc == 3))
11161 return alloc_node(argc == 2 ? ast_func_substring_2 : ast_func_substring_3, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
11162 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("sum")"sum" && argc == 1)
11163 {
11164 if (args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) return error("Function has to be applied to node set");
11165 return alloc_node(ast_func_sum, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
11166 }
11167
11168 break;
11169
11170 case 't':
11171 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("translate")"translate" && argc == 3)
11172 return alloc_node(ast_func_translate, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
11173 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("true")"true" && argc == 0)
11174 return alloc_node(ast_func_true, xpath_type_boolean);
11175
11176 break;
11177
11178 default:
11179 break;
11180 }
11181
11182 return error("Unrecognized function or wrong parameter count");
11183 }
11184
11185 axis_t parse_axis_name(const xpath_lexer_string& name, bool& specified)
11186 {
11187 specified = true;
11188
11189 switch (name.begin[0])
11190 {
11191 case 'a':
11192 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("ancestor")"ancestor")
11193 return axis_ancestor;
11194 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("ancestor-or-self")"ancestor-or-self")
11195 return axis_ancestor_or_self;
11196 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("attribute")"attribute")
11197 return axis_attribute;
11198
11199 break;
11200
11201 case 'c':
11202 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("child")"child")
11203 return axis_child;
11204
11205 break;
11206
11207 case 'd':
11208 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("descendant")"descendant")
11209 return axis_descendant;
11210 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("descendant-or-self")"descendant-or-self")
11211 return axis_descendant_or_self;
11212
11213 break;
11214
11215 case 'f':
11216 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("following")"following")
11217 return axis_following;
11218 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("following-sibling")"following-sibling")
11219 return axis_following_sibling;
11220
11221 break;
11222
11223 case 'n':
11224 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("namespace")"namespace")
11225 return axis_namespace;
11226
11227 break;
11228
11229 case 'p':
11230 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("parent")"parent")
11231 return axis_parent;
11232 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("preceding")"preceding")
11233 return axis_preceding;
11234 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("preceding-sibling")"preceding-sibling")
11235 return axis_preceding_sibling;
11236
11237 break;
11238
11239 case 's':
11240 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("self")"self")
11241 return axis_self;
11242
11243 break;
11244
11245 default:
11246 break;
11247 }
11248
11249 specified = false;
11250 return axis_child;
11251 }
11252
11253 nodetest_t parse_node_test_type(const xpath_lexer_string& name)
11254 {
11255 switch (name.begin[0])
11256 {
11257 case 'c':
11258 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("comment")"comment")
11259 return nodetest_type_comment;
11260
11261 break;
11262
11263 case 'n':
11264 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("node")"node")
11265 return nodetest_type_node;
11266
11267 break;
11268
11269 case 'p':
11270 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("processing-instruction")"processing-instruction")
11271 return nodetest_type_pi;
11272
11273 break;
11274
11275 case 't':
11276 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("text")"text")
11277 return nodetest_type_text;
11278
11279 break;
11280
11281 default:
11282 break;
11283 }
11284
11285 return nodetest_none;
11286 }
11287
11288 // PrimaryExpr ::= VariableReference | '(' Expr ')' | Literal | Number | FunctionCall
11289 xpath_ast_node* parse_primary_expression()
11290 {
11291 switch (_lexer.current())
11292 {
11293 case lex_var_ref:
11294 {
11295 xpath_lexer_string name = _lexer.contents();
11296
11297 if (!_variables)
11298 return error("Unknown variable: variable set is not provided");
11299
11300 xpath_variable* var = 0;
11301 if (!get_variable_scratch(_scratch, _variables, name.begin, name.end, &var))
11302 return error_oom();
11303
11304 if (!var)
11305 return error("Unknown variable: variable set does not contain the given name");
11306
11307 _lexer.next();
11308
11309 return alloc_node(ast_variable, var->type(), var);
11310 }
11311
11312 case lex_open_brace:
11313 {
11314 _lexer.next();
11315
11316 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression();
11317 if (!n) return 0;
11318
11319 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
11320 return error("Expected ')' to match an opening '('");
11321
11322 _lexer.next();
11323
11324 return n;
11325 }
11326
11327 case lex_quoted_string:
11328 {
11329 const char_t* value = alloc_string(_lexer.contents());
11330 if (!value) return 0;
11331
11332 _lexer.next();
11333
11334 return alloc_node(ast_string_constant, xpath_type_string, value);
11335 }
11336
11337 case lex_number:
11338 {
11339 double value = 0;
11340
11341 if (!convert_string_to_number_scratch(_scratch, _lexer.contents().begin, _lexer.contents().end, &value))
11342 return error_oom();
11343
11344 _lexer.next();
11345
11346 return alloc_node(ast_number_constant, xpath_type_number, value);
11347 }
11348
11349 case lex_string:
11350 {
11351 xpath_ast_node* args[2] = {0};
11352 size_t argc = 0;
11353
11354 xpath_lexer_string function = _lexer.contents();
11355 _lexer.next();
11356
11357 xpath_ast_node* last_arg = 0;
11358
11359 if (_lexer.current() != lex_open_brace)
11360 return error("Unrecognized function call");
11361 _lexer.next();
11362
11363 while (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
11364 {
11365 if (argc > 0)
11366 {
11367 if (_lexer.current() != lex_comma)
11368 return error("No comma between function arguments");
11369 _lexer.next();
11370 }
11371
11372 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression();
11373 if (!n) return 0;
11374
11375 if (argc < 2) args[argc] = n;
11376 else last_arg->set_next(n);
11377
11378 argc++;
11379 last_arg = n;
11380 }
11381
11382 _lexer.next();
11383
11384 return parse_function(function, argc, args);
11385 }
11386
11387 default:
11388 return error("Unrecognizable primary expression");
11389 }
11390 }
11391
11392 // FilterExpr ::= PrimaryExpr | FilterExpr Predicate
11393 // Predicate ::= '[' PredicateExpr ']'
11394 // PredicateExpr ::= Expr
11395 xpath_ast_node* parse_filter_expression()
11396 {
11397 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_primary_expression();
11398 if (!n) return 0;
11399
11400 while (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace)
11401 {
11402 _lexer.next();
11403
11404 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
11405 return error("Predicate has to be applied to node set");
11406
11407 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_expression();
11408 if (!expr) return 0;
11409
11410 n = alloc_node(ast_filter, n, expr, predicate_default);
11411 if (!n) return 0;
11412
11413 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_square_brace)
11414 return error("Expected ']' to match an opening '['");
11415
11416 _lexer.next();
11417 }
11418
11419 return n;
11420 }
11421
11422 // Step ::= AxisSpecifier NodeTest Predicate* | AbbreviatedStep
11423 // AxisSpecifier ::= AxisName '::' | '@'?
11424 // NodeTest ::= NameTest | NodeType '(' ')' | 'processing-instruction' '(' Literal ')'
11425 // NameTest ::= '*' | NCName ':' '*' | QName
11426 // AbbreviatedStep ::= '.' | '..'
11427 xpath_ast_node* parse_step(xpath_ast_node* set)
11428 {
11429 if (set && set->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
11430 return error("Step has to be applied to node set");
11431
11432 bool axis_specified = false;
11433 axis_t axis = axis_child; // implied child axis
11434
11435 if (_lexer.current() == lex_axis_attribute)
11436 {
11437 axis = axis_attribute;
11438 axis_specified = true;
11439
11440 _lexer.next();
11441 }
11442 else if (_lexer.current() == lex_dot)
11443 {
11444 _lexer.next();
11445
11446 if (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace)
11447 return error("Predicates are not allowed after an abbreviated step");
11448
11449 return alloc_node(ast_step, set, axis_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
11450 }
11451 else if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_dot)
11452 {
11453 _lexer.next();
11454
11455 if (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace)
11456 return error("Predicates are not allowed after an abbreviated step");
11457
11458 return alloc_node(ast_step, set, axis_parent, nodetest_type_node, 0);
11459 }
11460
11461 nodetest_t nt_type = nodetest_none;
11462 xpath_lexer_string nt_name;
11463
11464 if (_lexer.current() == lex_string)
11465 {
11466 // node name test
11467 nt_name = _lexer.contents();
11468 _lexer.next();
11469
11470 // was it an axis name?
11471 if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_colon)
11472 {
11473 // parse axis name
11474 if (axis_specified)
11475 return error("Two axis specifiers in one step");
11476
11477 axis = parse_axis_name(nt_name, axis_specified);
11478
11479 if (!axis_specified)
11480 return error("Unknown axis");
11481
11482 // read actual node test
11483 _lexer.next();
11484
11485 if (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply)
11486 {
11487 nt_type = nodetest_all;
11488 nt_name = xpath_lexer_string();
11489 _lexer.next();
11490 }
11491 else if (_lexer.current() == lex_string)
11492 {
11493 nt_name = _lexer.contents();
11494 _lexer.next();
11495 }
11496 else
11497 {
11498 return error("Unrecognized node test");
11499 }
11500 }
11501
11502 if (nt_type == nodetest_none)
11503 {
11504 // node type test or processing-instruction
11505 if (_lexer.current() == lex_open_brace)
11506 {
11507 _lexer.next();
11508
11509 if (_lexer.current() == lex_close_brace)
11510 {
11511 _lexer.next();
11512
11513 nt_type = parse_node_test_type(nt_name);
11514
11515 if (nt_type == nodetest_none)
11516 return error("Unrecognized node type");
11517
11518 nt_name = xpath_lexer_string();
11519 }
11520 else if (nt_name == PUGIXML_TEXT("processing-instruction")"processing-instruction")
11521 {
11522 if (_lexer.current() != lex_quoted_string)
11523 return error("Only literals are allowed as arguments to processing-instruction()");
11524
11525 nt_type = nodetest_pi;
11526 nt_name = _lexer.contents();
11527 _lexer.next();
11528
11529 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
11530 return error("Unmatched brace near processing-instruction()");
11531 _lexer.next();
11532 }
11533 else
11534 {
11535 return error("Unmatched brace near node type test");
11536 }
11537 }
11538 // QName or NCName:*
11539 else
11540 {
11541 if (nt_name.end - nt_name.begin > 2 && nt_name.end[-2] == ':' && nt_name.end[-1] == '*') // NCName:*
11542 {
11543 nt_name.end--; // erase *
11544
11545 nt_type = nodetest_all_in_namespace;
11546 }
11547 else
11548 {
11549 nt_type = nodetest_name;
11550 }
11551 }
11552 }
11553 }
11554 else if (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply)
11555 {
11556 nt_type = nodetest_all;
11557 _lexer.next();
11558 }
11559 else
11560 {
11561 return error("Unrecognized node test");
11562 }
11563
11564 const char_t* nt_name_copy = alloc_string(nt_name);
11565 if (!nt_name_copy) return 0;
11566
11567 xpath_ast_node* n = alloc_node(ast_step, set, axis, nt_type, nt_name_copy);
11568 if (!n) return 0;
11569
11570 xpath_ast_node* last = 0;
11571
11572 while (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace)
11573 {
11574 _lexer.next();
11575
11576 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_expression();
11577 if (!expr) return 0;
11578
11579 xpath_ast_node* pred = alloc_node(ast_predicate, 0, expr, predicate_default);
11580 if (!pred) return 0;
11581
11582 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_square_brace)
11583 return error("Expected ']' to match an opening '['");
11584 _lexer.next();
11585
11586 if (last) last->set_next(pred);
11587 else n->set_right(pred);
11588
11589 last = pred;
11590 }
11591
11592 return n;
11593 }
11594
11595 // RelativeLocationPath ::= Step | RelativeLocationPath '/' Step | RelativeLocationPath '//' Step
11596 xpath_ast_node* parse_relative_location_path(xpath_ast_node* set)
11597 {
11598 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_step(set);
11599 if (!n) return 0;
11600
11601 while (_lexer.current() == lex_slash || _lexer.current() == lex_double_slash)
11602 {
11603 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
11604 _lexer.next();
11605
11606 if (l == lex_double_slash)
11607 {
11608 n = alloc_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
11609 if (!n) return 0;
11610 }
11611
11612 n = parse_step(n);
11613 if (!n) return 0;
11614 }
11615
11616 return n;
11617 }
11618
11619 // LocationPath ::= RelativeLocationPath | AbsoluteLocationPath
11620 // AbsoluteLocationPath ::= '/' RelativeLocationPath? | '//' RelativeLocationPath
11621 xpath_ast_node* parse_location_path()
11622 {
11623 if (_lexer.current() == lex_slash)
11624 {
11625 _lexer.next();
11626
11627 xpath_ast_node* n = alloc_node(ast_step_root, xpath_type_node_set);
11628 if (!n) return 0;
11629
11630 // relative location path can start from axis_attribute, dot, double_dot, multiply and string lexemes; any other lexeme means standalone root path
11631 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
11632
11633 if (l == lex_string || l == lex_axis_attribute || l == lex_dot || l == lex_double_dot || l == lex_multiply)
11634 return parse_relative_location_path(n);
11635 else
11636 return n;
11637 }
11638 else if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_slash)
11639 {
11640 _lexer.next();
11641
11642 xpath_ast_node* n = alloc_node(ast_step_root, xpath_type_node_set);
11643 if (!n) return 0;
11644
11645 n = alloc_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
11646 if (!n) return 0;
11647
11648 return parse_relative_location_path(n);
11649 }
11650
11651 // else clause moved outside of if because of bogus warning 'control may reach end of non-void function being inlined' in gcc 4.0.1
11652 return parse_relative_location_path(0);
11653 }
11654
11655 // PathExpr ::= LocationPath
11656 // | FilterExpr
11657 // | FilterExpr '/' RelativeLocationPath
11658 // | FilterExpr '//' RelativeLocationPath
11659 // UnionExpr ::= PathExpr | UnionExpr '|' PathExpr
11660 // UnaryExpr ::= UnionExpr | '-' UnaryExpr
11661 xpath_ast_node* parse_path_or_unary_expression()
11662 {
11663 // Clarification.
11664 // PathExpr begins with either LocationPath or FilterExpr.
11665 // FilterExpr begins with PrimaryExpr
11666 // PrimaryExpr begins with '$' in case of it being a variable reference,
11667 // '(' in case of it being an expression, string literal, number constant or
11668 // function call.
11669 if (_lexer.current() == lex_var_ref || _lexer.current() == lex_open_brace ||
11670 _lexer.current() == lex_quoted_string || _lexer.current() == lex_number ||
11671 _lexer.current() == lex_string)
11672 {
11673 if (_lexer.current() == lex_string)
11674 {
11675 // This is either a function call, or not - if not, we shall proceed with location path
11676 const char_t* state = _lexer.state();
11677
11678 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*state, ct_space)) ++state;
11679
11680 if (*state != '(')
11681 return parse_location_path();
11682
11683 // This looks like a function call; however this still can be a node-test. Check it.
11684 if (parse_node_test_type(_lexer.contents()) != nodetest_none)
11685 return parse_location_path();
11686 }
11687
11688 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_filter_expression();
11689 if (!n) return 0;
11690
11691 if (_lexer.current() == lex_slash || _lexer.current() == lex_double_slash)
11692 {
11693 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
11694 _lexer.next();
11695
11696 if (l == lex_double_slash)
11697 {
11698 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
11699 return error("Step has to be applied to node set");
11700
11701 n = alloc_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
11702 if (!n) return 0;
11703 }
11704
11705 // select from location path
11706 return parse_relative_location_path(n);
11707 }
11708
11709 return n;
11710 }
11711 else if (_lexer.current() == lex_minus)
11712 {
11713 _lexer.next();
11714
11715 // precedence 7+ - only parses union expressions
11716 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression(7);
11717 if (!n) return 0;
11718
11719 return alloc_node(ast_op_negate, xpath_type_number, n);
11720 }
11721 else
11722 {
11723 return parse_location_path();
11724 }
11725 }
11726
11727 struct binary_op_t
11728 {
11729 ast_type_t asttype;
11730 xpath_value_type rettype;
11731 int precedence;
11732
11733 binary_op_t(): asttype(ast_unknown), rettype(xpath_type_none), precedence(0)
11734 {
11735 }
11736
11737 binary_op_t(ast_type_t asttype_, xpath_value_type rettype_, int precedence_): asttype(asttype_), rettype(rettype_), precedence(precedence_)
11738 {
11739 }
11740
11741 static binary_op_t parse(xpath_lexer& lexer)
11742 {
11743 switch (lexer.current())
11744 {
11745 case lex_string:
11746 if (lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("or")"or")
11747 return binary_op_t(ast_op_or, xpath_type_boolean, 1);
11748 else if (lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("and")"and")
11749 return binary_op_t(ast_op_and, xpath_type_boolean, 2);
11750 else if (lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("div")"div")
11751 return binary_op_t(ast_op_divide, xpath_type_number, 6);
11752 else if (lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("mod")"mod")
11753 return binary_op_t(ast_op_mod, xpath_type_number, 6);
11754 else
11755 return binary_op_t();
11756
11757 case lex_equal:
11758 return binary_op_t(ast_op_equal, xpath_type_boolean, 3);
11759
11760 case lex_not_equal:
11761 return binary_op_t(ast_op_not_equal, xpath_type_boolean, 3);
11762
11763 case lex_less:
11764 return binary_op_t(ast_op_less, xpath_type_boolean, 4);
11765
11766 case lex_greater:
11767 return binary_op_t(ast_op_greater, xpath_type_boolean, 4);
11768
11769 case lex_less_or_equal:
11770 return binary_op_t(ast_op_less_or_equal, xpath_type_boolean, 4);
11771
11772 case lex_greater_or_equal:
11773 return binary_op_t(ast_op_greater_or_equal, xpath_type_boolean, 4);
11774
11775 case lex_plus:
11776 return binary_op_t(ast_op_add, xpath_type_number, 5);
11777
11778 case lex_minus:
11779 return binary_op_t(ast_op_subtract, xpath_type_number, 5);
11780
11781 case lex_multiply:
11782 return binary_op_t(ast_op_multiply, xpath_type_number, 6);
11783
11784 case lex_union:
11785 return binary_op_t(ast_op_union, xpath_type_node_set, 7);
11786
11787 default:
11788 return binary_op_t();
11789 }
11790 }
11791 };
11792
11793 xpath_ast_node* parse_expression_rec(xpath_ast_node* lhs, int limit)
11794 {
11795 binary_op_t op = binary_op_t::parse(_lexer);
11796
11797 while (op.asttype != ast_unknown && op.precedence >= limit)
11798 {
11799 _lexer.next();
11800
11801 xpath_ast_node* rhs = parse_path_or_unary_expression();
11802 if (!rhs) return 0;
11803
11804 binary_op_t nextop = binary_op_t::parse(_lexer);
11805
11806 while (nextop.asttype != ast_unknown && nextop.precedence > op.precedence)
11807 {
11808 rhs = parse_expression_rec(rhs, nextop.precedence);
11809 if (!rhs) return 0;
11810
11811 nextop = binary_op_t::parse(_lexer);
11812 }
11813
11814 if (op.asttype == ast_op_union && (lhs->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set || rhs->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set))
11815 return error("Union operator has to be applied to node sets");
11816
11817 lhs = alloc_node(op.asttype, op.rettype, lhs, rhs);
11818 if (!lhs) return 0;
11819
11820 op = binary_op_t::parse(_lexer);
11821 }
11822
11823 return lhs;
11824 }
11825
11826 // Expr ::= OrExpr
11827 // OrExpr ::= AndExpr | OrExpr 'or' AndExpr
11828 // AndExpr ::= EqualityExpr | AndExpr 'and' EqualityExpr
11829 // EqualityExpr ::= RelationalExpr
11830 // | EqualityExpr '=' RelationalExpr
11831 // | EqualityExpr '!=' RelationalExpr
11832 // RelationalExpr ::= AdditiveExpr
11833 // | RelationalExpr '<' AdditiveExpr
11834 // | RelationalExpr '>' AdditiveExpr
11835 // | RelationalExpr '<=' AdditiveExpr
11836 // | RelationalExpr '>=' AdditiveExpr
11837 // AdditiveExpr ::= MultiplicativeExpr
11838 // | AdditiveExpr '+' MultiplicativeExpr
11839 // | AdditiveExpr '-' MultiplicativeExpr
11840 // MultiplicativeExpr ::= UnaryExpr
11841 // | MultiplicativeExpr '*' UnaryExpr
11842 // | MultiplicativeExpr 'div' UnaryExpr
11843 // | MultiplicativeExpr 'mod' UnaryExpr
11844 xpath_ast_node* parse_expression(int limit = 0)
11845 {
11846 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_path_or_unary_expression();
11847 if (!n) return 0;
6
←
Assuming 'n' is non-null
→
7
←
Taking false branch
→
11848
11849 return parse_expression_rec(n, limit);
11850 }
11851
11852 xpath_parser(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables, xpath_allocator* alloc, xpath_parse_result* result): _alloc(alloc), _lexer(query), _query(query), _variables(variables), _result(result)
11853 {
11854 }
11855
11856 xpath_ast_node* parse()
11857 {
11858 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression();
5
←
Calling 'xpath_parser::parse_expression'
→
8
←
Returning from 'xpath_parser::parse_expression'
→
11859 if (!n) return 0;
9
←
Taking false branch
→
11860
11861 // check if there are unparsed tokens left
11862 if (_lexer.current() != lex_eof)
10
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
11
←
Taking false branch
→
11863 return error("Incorrect query");
11864
11865 return n;
11866 }
11867
11868 static xpath_ast_node* parse(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables, xpath_allocator* alloc, xpath_parse_result* result)
11869 {
11870 xpath_parser parser(query, variables, alloc, result);
11871
11872 return parser.parse();
4
←
Calling 'xpath_parser::parse'
→
12
←
Returning from 'xpath_parser::parse'
→
11873 }
11874 };
11875
11876 struct xpath_query_impl
11877 {
11878 static xpath_query_impl* create()
11879 {
11880 void* memory = xml_memory::allocate(sizeof(xpath_query_impl));
11881 if (!memory) return 0;
11882
11883 return new (memory) xpath_query_impl();
11884 }
11885
11886 static void destroy(xpath_query_impl* impl)
11887 {
11888 // free all allocated pages
11889 impl->alloc.release();
11890
11891 // free allocator memory (with the first page)
11892 xml_memory::deallocate(impl);
11893 }
11894
11895 xpath_query_impl(): root(0), alloc(&block, &oom), oom(false)
11896 {
11897 block.next = 0;
11898 block.capacity = sizeof(block.data);
11899 }
11900
11901 xpath_ast_node* root;
11902 xpath_allocator alloc;
11903 xpath_memory_block block;
11904 bool oom;
11905 };
11906
11907 PUGI__FN impl::xpath_ast_node* evaluate_node_set_prepare(xpath_query_impl* impl)
11908 {
11909 if (!impl) return 0;
11910
11911 if (impl->root->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
11912 {
11913 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
11914 return 0;
11915 #else
11916 xpath_parse_result res;
11917 res.error = "Expression does not evaluate to node set";
11918
11919 throw xpath_exception(res);
11920 #endif
11921 }
11922
11923 return impl->root;
11924 }
11925PUGI__NS_END
11926
11927namespace pugi
11928{
11929#ifndef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
11930 PUGI__FN xpath_exception::xpath_exception(const xpath_parse_result& result_): _result(result_)
11931 {
11932 assert(_result.error)(static_cast <bool> (_result.error) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("_result.error", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 11932, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
11933 }
11934
11935 PUGI__FN const char* xpath_exception::what() const throw()
11936 {
11937 return _result.error;
11938 }
11939
11940 PUGI__FN const xpath_parse_result& xpath_exception::result() const
11941 {
11942 return _result;
11943 }
11944#endif
11945
11946 PUGI__FN xpath_node::xpath_node()
11947 {
11948 }
11949
11950 PUGI__FN xpath_node::xpath_node(const xml_node& node_): _node(node_)
11951 {
11952 }
11953
11954 PUGI__FN xpath_node::xpath_node(const xml_attribute& attribute_, const xml_node& parent_): _node(attribute_ ? parent_ : xml_node()), _attribute(attribute_)
11955 {
11956 }
11957
11958 PUGI__FN xml_node xpath_node::node() const
11959 {
11960 return _attribute ? xml_node() : _node;
11961 }
11962
11963 PUGI__FN xml_attribute xpath_node::attribute() const
11964 {
11965 return _attribute;
11966 }
11967
11968 PUGI__FN xml_node xpath_node::parent() const
11969 {
11970 return _attribute ? _node : _node.parent();
11971 }
11972
11973 PUGI__FN static void unspecified_bool_xpath_node(xpath_node***)
11974 {
11975 }
11976
11977 PUGI__FN xpath_node::operator xpath_node::unspecified_bool_type() const
11978 {
11979 return (_node || _attribute) ? unspecified_bool_xpath_node : 0;
11980 }
11981
11982 PUGI__FN bool xpath_node::operator!() const
11983 {
11984 return !(_node || _attribute);
11985 }
11986
11987 PUGI__FN bool xpath_node::operator==(const xpath_node& n) const
11988 {
11989 return _node == n._node && _attribute == n._attribute;
11990 }
11991
11992 PUGI__FN bool xpath_node::operator!=(const xpath_node& n) const
11993 {
11994 return _node != n._node || _attribute != n._attribute;
11995 }
11996
11997#ifdef __BORLANDC__
11998 PUGI__FN bool operator&&(const xpath_node& lhs, bool rhs)
11999 {
12000 return (bool)lhs && rhs;
12001 }
12002
12003 PUGI__FN bool operator||(const xpath_node& lhs, bool rhs)
12004 {
12005 return (bool)lhs || rhs;
12006 }
12007#endif
12008
12009 PUGI__FN void xpath_node_set::_assign(const_iterator begin_, const_iterator end_, type_t type_)
12010 {
12011 assert(begin_ <= end_)(static_cast <bool> (begin_ <= end_) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("begin_ <= end_", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 12011, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
12012
12013 size_t size_ = static_cast<size_t>(end_ - begin_);
12014
12015 if (size_ <= 1)
12016 {
12017 // deallocate old buffer
12018 if (_begin != &_storage) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
12019
12020 // use internal buffer
12021 if (begin_ != end_) _storage = *begin_;
12022
12023 _begin = &_storage;
12024 _end = &_storage + size_;
12025 _type = type_;
12026 }
12027 else
12028 {
12029 // make heap copy
12030 xpath_node* storage = static_cast<xpath_node*>(impl::xml_memory::allocate(size_ * sizeof(xpath_node)));
12031
12032 if (!storage)
12033 {
12034 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
12035 return;
12036 #else
12037 throw std::bad_alloc();
12038 #endif
12039 }
12040
12041 memcpy(storage, begin_, size_ * sizeof(xpath_node));
12042
12043 // deallocate old buffer
12044 if (_begin != &_storage) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
12045
12046 // finalize
12047 _begin = storage;
12048 _end = storage + size_;
12049 _type = type_;
12050 }
12051 }
12052
12053#ifdef PUGIXML_HAS_MOVE
12054 PUGI__FN void xpath_node_set::_move(xpath_node_set& rhs) PUGIXML_NOEXCEPTnoexcept
12055 {
12056 _type = rhs._type;
12057 _storage = rhs._storage;
12058 _begin = (rhs._begin == &rhs._storage) ? &_storage : rhs._begin;
12059 _end = _begin + (rhs._end - rhs._begin);
12060
12061 rhs._type = type_unsorted;
12062 rhs._begin = &rhs._storage;
12063 rhs._end = rhs._begin;
12064 }
12065#endif
12066
12067 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(): _type(type_unsorted), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
12068 {
12069 }
12070
12071 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(const_iterator begin_, const_iterator end_, type_t type_): _type(type_unsorted), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
12072 {
12073 _assign(begin_, end_, type_);
12074 }
12075
12076 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::~xpath_node_set()
12077 {
12078 if (_begin != &_storage)
12079 impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
12080 }
12081
12082 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(const xpath_node_set& ns): _type(type_unsorted), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
12083 {
12084 _assign(ns._begin, ns._end, ns._type);
12085 }
12086
12087 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set& xpath_node_set::operator=(const xpath_node_set& ns)
12088 {
12089 if (this == &ns) return *this;
12090
12091 _assign(ns._begin, ns._end, ns._type);
12092
12093 return *this;
12094 }

12096#ifdef PUGIXML_HAS_MOVE
12097 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(xpath_node_set&& rhs) PUGIXML_NOEXCEPTnoexcept: _type(type_unsorted), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
12098 {
12099 _move(rhs);
12100 }
12101
12102 PUGI__FN xpath_node_set& xpath_node_set::operator=(xpath_node_set&& rhs) PUGIXML_NOEXCEPTnoexcept
12103 {
12104 if (this == &rhs) return *this;
12105
12106 if (_begin != &_storage)
12107 impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
12108
12109 _move(rhs);
12110
12111 return *this;
12112 }
12113#endif

12121 {
12122 return _end - _begin;

12125 PUGI__FN bool xpath_node_set::empty() const
12126 {
12127 return _begin == _end;

12131 {
12132 assert(index < size())(static_cast <bool> (index < size()) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("index < size()", "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 12132, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
12133 return _begin[index];
12134 }

12170 PUGI__FN xpath_variable::xpath_variable(xpath_value_type type_): _type(type_), _next(0)
12171 {
12172 }
12173
12174 PUGI__FN const char_t* xpath_variable::name() const
12175 {
12176 switch (_type)
12177 {
12178 case xpath_type_node_set:
12179 return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_node_set*>(this)->name;
12180
12181 case xpath_type_number:
12182 return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_number*>(this)->name;
12183
12184 case xpath_type_string:
12185 return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_string*>(this)->name;
12186
12187 case xpath_type_boolean:
12188 return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_boolean*>(this)->name;
12189
12190 default:
12191 assert(false && "Invalid variable type")(static_cast <bool> (false && "Invalid variable type"
) ? void (0) : __assert_fail ("false && \"Invalid variable type\""
, "/home/chuck/Code/adios2/source/master/thirdparty/pugixml/pugixml/src/pugixml.cpp"
, 12191, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__)); // unreachable
12192 return 0;
12193 }
12194 }
12195

12197 {
12198 return _type;
12199 }

12201 PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable::get_boolean() const
12202 {
12203 return (_type == xpath_type_boolean) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_boolean*>(this)->value : false;
12204 }
12205
12206 PUGI__FN double xpath_variable::get_number() const
12207 {
12208 return (_type == xpath_type_number) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_number*>(this)->value : impl::gen_nan();
12209 }
12210
12211 PUGI__FN const char_t* xpath_variable::get_string() const
12212 {
12213 const char_t* value = (_type == xpath_type_string) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_string*>(this)->value : 0;
12214 return value ? value : PUGIXML_TEXT("")"";
12215 }
